summary: Email chain between federal prosecutors and attorney Robert Glassman regarding scheduling a meeting with his client (a victim/witness) for the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss logistics, topics for discussion, and mention the client's mother being overseas.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney representing a client (a victim/witness) in the SDNY investigation, coordinating a meeting with prosecutors.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: SDNY prosecutor copied on emails discussing investigation logistics and meeting scheduling.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: SDNY prosecutor corresponding with Robert Glassman to schedule a meeting with his client.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the SDNY investigation, whose specific conduct is a topic for discussion with the witness.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named alongside Epstein as a subject of the SDNY investigation, whose specific conduct is a topic for discussion.

connections.description: Glassman is scheduling a meeting between his client (a victim/witness) and SDNY prosecutors.
Attorney and prosecutor communicating to coordinate a witness interview for the SDNY investigation.
SDNY prosecutors working together on the investigation, both copied on scheduling emails.
The client is a witness/victim whose interview will cover specific conduct by Epstein.
The client is a witness/victim whose interview will cover specific conduct by Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduling Email for Witness Interview
events.description: Final email confirming a meeting time of 11:00 a.m. on Monday between SDNY prosecutors and Robert Glassman's client.

events.title: Prosecutors Outline Interview Topics
events.description: Prosecutors email Glassman outlining planned discussion topics for the upcoming witness interview, including travel details and specific conduct by Epstein and Maxwell.

locations: Robert Glassman's office (implied location for meeting)
keyFacts: SDNY prosecutors were actively scheduling in-person interviews with victims/witnesses represented by attorney Robert Glassman in December 2019.
Planned interview topics included the witness's travel, steps for corroboration, and specific conduct by Jeffrey Epstein and/or Ghislaine Maxwell.
The witness's mother was reported to be living overseas, not in the United States.
The correspondence shows the logistical coordination and attorney-client protections involved in the SDNY investigation post-Epstein's death.
The document is part of a series of emails (EFTA00016896-EFTA00016900) concerning this witness interview.
